channel.title: december-2022-update on Scott French
channel.description: Recent content in december-2022-update on Scott French

item.title: December 2022 Update
item.description: The last few months of the year are always busy around here. Holidays, birthdays, anniversaries, school events, and end-of-year work always means there is no free time. It's been a great and full year for my family so I have no complaints, but I have not been able to touch anything guitar related in some time. I'm coming into the New Year with even more focus than last year, so I'm excited for the coming months.

item.title: Mesa Boogie Imbuia & Wicker Thiele Compact Ported Cab
item.description: This is the Holy Grail of Mesa cabs, a vintage hardwood & wicker Thiele with Electro-Voice EVM-12L from 1987. When you consider this thing is over 30 years old it is in pretty nice shape. It was made using amazing 13" wide imbuia boards. Condition is pretty nice overall. There are dents and dings throughout, but overall it presents pretty well. Weight is 48lbs. I've purchased this cab twice and both times it was poorly packaged.

item.title: Mesa Boogie Hardwood & Wicker Dual Rectifier Blue Angel 2x10" Combo
item.description: This Blue Angel combo is a really cool and very un-Mesa like amp. I don't think they ever made and another 2x10" as far as I remember and to find one in hardwood was an amazing surprise. There are no markings inside, but if I had to guess I would say it is Imbuia. The power section of this amp mixing tube types with switchable combinations is also very strange and worth looking into if you're interested in something different for Mesa Boogie.

item.title: Mesa Boogie Thiele Ported Compact Cab in Imbuia Hardwood & Wicker
item.description: This is the Holy Grail of Mesa cabs, a vintage hardwood & wicker Thiele with EVM-12L from the Mark III era. When you consider this thing is around 30 years old it is in pretty nice shape. It was made using amazing 13" wide imbuia boards. Condition is pretty nice overall. There are dents and dings throughout, and also some substantial scratches on top from amp feet. The speaker and it has a 1989 date code.

item.title: Mesa Boogie Padauk & Wicker Half-Back Speaker Cabinet
item.description: This is a beautiful Mesa speaker cabinet, a vintage hardwood & wicker half-back with original EVM-12L from the early 80s. When you consider this thing is around 35 years old it is in almost perfect shape. It was made using amazing 11" wide boards. Based on the grain and era I think this may be padauk. There are no factory markings inside the cab but based on the logo plate and jack mount it looks to be from the Mark II/IIB/IIC/IIC+ era.

item.title: Mesa Boogie Hardwood & Wicker Mark IIC Combo
item.description: This is a very clean Mark IIC in its original hardwood & wicker cabinet. It's a 60 watt model with reverb. The speaker is a Mesa/Celestion Black Shadow MC-90. I am not sure the wood species, but it does seem to fit in with other hardwood Mark series amps of this era. My guess would be padauk. When I purchased this amp I was told it had a recent service/cleaning including new caps and power cord.
